meanings.definition: Existing or occurring at the same time
meanings.sent1: The professor emphasized the contemporaneousness of the two historical events.
meanings.sent2: The art pieces displayed in the museum are all of contemporaneousness.
meanings.sent3: The party decorations had a quirky contemporaneousness that made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The music festival captured the contemporaneousness of different genres blending together.
meanings.sent5: The sunset and sunrise happening at the same time showed a beautiful contemporaneousness.

meanings.definition: Of the same time period or era
meanings.sent1: The architecture of the buildings reflects the contemporaneousness of the city's development.
meanings.sent2: The fashion trends of the 1920s and 1930s have a clear sense of contemporaneousness.
meanings.sent3: The detective's investigation into the time-traveling toaster had a humorous touch of contemporaneousness.
meanings.sent4: The novel's plot cleverly weaved in the contemporaneousness of past and present events.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting depicted the contemporaneousness of nature and technology colliding.
